reviewText:
This is a short visual novel that focuses on the life of an emperor and his sister. So what's good about this game, and what's not. Well..

Pros:
- a little art of slightly undressed women, i guess..

Cons:
- Horrible soundtrack, repeats every god damn minute
- Uninspired writing, with grammar mistakes and dull language
- Subpar art at best
- Writing that tells a rubbish story without more or less any substance or reason
- Throwing in lines about killing people for fun + lesbian and incest things without explaining why, and without it adding anything to the story. Just having it there for the lol's i guess

That's more or less what this game is, i would not reccomend buying it. Not even at this price, simply because you would be wasting your time. And as a final note, you can change three sound settings in the options menu. You can change music, speech and effects". Yet
date: the only sound in-game is a really annoying soundtrack... Wonder where the other sound elements are
recommended: maybe they are in the next game.. If you want to look at it some more
hoursPlayed: you can check out my youtube video of it below.\n\nGameplay video: https://youtu.be/FkADB9gC1Rk"

reviewText: You can find my full review on The Backlog.[www.the-backlog.net]\n\nWhere to even start with Drusilla Dreams... Well, it's a VN that supposedly follows up" the story from the game I Am Caligula. It definitely follows in I Am Caligula's footsteps in terms of absolutely awful writing
recommended: and spelling. The story reads a lot more like a poor fanfic (or
voteText: "real person fiction" would be the accurate term). You have the original character Lucca who is apparently the favourite slave of Drusilla.\n\nI cannot suggest Drusilla Dreams at all
helpfulPercent: and I highly suggest you run far
votesHelpful: far away from it. There are FAR better VNs out there that cost less than this (and this already does not cost very much). If you want to find out more about the real Drusilla and Caligula
votesTotal: go to wikipedia and don't support this game. Also be warned that there is a fair bit of sex talk in the short amount of time this VN will take. It's something that makes me question why this game doesn't have some sort of age gate on it
votesFunny: but what do I know in terms of that I suppose."

reviewText:
So, after bickering with someone that seems to believe this... Thing" is actually good. I took the liberty of wasting $0.64 just to see how garbage this mess really was. AND BOY IS IT GARBAGE!

PROS:
If you're into incest and lesbianism
date: then this is for you.\nIf you have poor eyesight
recommended: then the art style can be actually quite refreshing and worth noting for it's "intricate" design.\nIf you like your games less than an hour long
hoursPlayed: and about the rate of completion on par
helpfulPercent:
then is a worthy investment.
Buy this game if lighting dollars on fire is a natural pass-time for you.
It has multiple endings.

CONS:
As soon as you start up the game
votesHelpful: you're greeted with a screen devoid of any audio.\nThe UI
votesTotal: if you can call it that
votesFunny: looks like vomited feces that has pieces of corn in it of varying widths.\nSpeaking of audio. I've not once heard any voiceovers
commentsCount: and the background music gets grating after the second loop... Which loops pretty often if you're a slow reader like I am. Fortunately
column16: it has more than one track.\nIt's riddled with spelling errors
column18: you'd almost think this was made by a bunch of Weeaboos with a love for history *COUGH*. Excuse me
column19: I have an allergic reaction to my own irony.\nThe ability to make decisions happens once in a while
column20: and dictate when and how your ending will play off. If you think that's normal
column21: you'd be right... Except if you spacebar'd through the monotonous text
column22: then decisions mean nothing since the game ends as quickly as it began.\nI'm not very good at history or linguistics
column23: but I'm pretty sure Romans didn't talk like these people. I'm not even refering to the fact that English probably wasn't their primary language.\nRemember those endings I mentioned earlier? Yeah
column24: there's probably like 4-8 (I only encountered 3 of my own) endings
column25: and each one is just a history lesson about the two protagonists. I'm referring to Caligula
column26: and Drussila. Oops... SPOILERS! Like it matters...\nSpeaking of Caligula. He's in this game for some reason
column27: which contradicts the whole point of Drussila "overthrowing him"
column28: considering that in one of the history lessons that preceeds one of the endings
column29: it mentions he passed the throne to Drussila after falling ill. Hmm....\nThe text box sucks. It's far bigger than it needs to be 90% of the game
column30: and when text does fill the window entirely
column32: BAD GRAMMAR & PPFT-WHO-NEEDS-WORD-WRAP.\nRemember how I said the art style is great for those with poor eyesight? Now
column33: if you can accurately see your screen
column35: then you'll probably agree the characters and the accompanying background look atrocious. I mean
column36: most DeviantArtist's would likely agree that it looks "nice"
column37: but this isn't DeviantArt.\nIt kicks actual Visual Novels in the balls for being better at being a VN than this monstrosity. By that
column38:
I mean it isn't a Visual Novel-- Because it's not the length of a novel... Not even a Light Novel.
There's controller config in the options......... Why?


Final Thoughts:
If I can get my money back
column39: I likely will proceed in doing so. Even if it's a measly $0.64. That 64 cents was spent to prove a point. The point has been made
column40: and I'd rather go back and play Zombie National Park before I play another "game" by this company again. Here's a small album of a few screenshots I took showcasing some of the "excitement": http://imgur.com/a/PFbZX\n\n1/10 - Never again."

reviewText: Ok, I'll admit that this was my first interactive novel".  And unless it turns out I was missing something here I strongly suspect it'll also be my last.\n\nMaybe my expectations were too high.  I figured this would probably be some sort of Roman history fan fiction
date: but in less than 20 minutes I think I explored ALL of the possibilities and got all of the endings (4 or 5 I think).  Choices really didnt matter - this seriously lacks any sort of depth.  Ends after 2-3 "choices"...why does this even have a "save" option???"

reviewText:
I bought this game because I had $2 in my steam wallet. I spent $1. I got that $1 back.

Pros:
+ Works
+ Art is ok I guess

Cons:
- Horrible writing
- Tons of spelling and grammar mistakes
- I beat it in 8 minutes (Yes I read everything)
- Little music
- The developers can't handle criticism, banned me from the steam forums for criticising the game

So just... don't.

I edited the review to make it longer and more in-depth, here's the original:
You can beat this game in 8 minutes. Not worth the $1. Also the devs banned me from the forums for criticising the game.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Extremely short game, i was expecting probably another rpg after playing the first Caligula game but this one turns out to be a visual novel that has multiple endings based on the choices , it needs a lot of improvement.

The music was fine and you get some bits of history , hopefully the third game by this dev will combine the rpg elements and visual novel elements into a larger game.

Decent art style , i would only get it though at a extremely high discount despite its low price , again this misses out on achievement and cards both much sorted out by people who play such games.

Can only very barely recommend this one , approach with care. 6.5/ 10

reviewText:
I learned quite something from playing this game, because it's base on the history of rome.

It is a complete game, means there's music, there's decent art, and nice transition of story.

But there's still lots of improvement need to be done.

To sum up, i will recommand this game because this game do have potential to be a great visual novel.

reviewText: I am not a visual novel person much, but I do think this one will keep you entertain with it's art and visual style. Though it is really short and not too much interactive, you cannot really go wrong with it's price. Overall I recommend it for visual novel lovers.

reviewText:
Interesting niche game. There are a few niches here, Roman history and of course sexual perversion. If these excite you and you are into visual novels then this is for you.

Does not currently display in full screen mode.
Turn off your sound when playing though (until patched.)
